metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4276 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: Multiple stack-based buffer overflows in LittleCMS (aka lcms or liblcms) 1.19 and earlier allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) via a crafted (1) ICC color profile to the icctrans utility or (2) TIFF image to the tiffdiff utility.

notes.Note: jdstrand> ghostscript 9.07 in Ubuntu 13.04+ uses an embedded copy of lcms2

criterions.comment: lcms: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
